turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about B. W. Huebsch.
turn.1: When did B. W. Huebsch die?
turn.2: He died in London on August 7, 1964.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Huebsch's papers are archived at the Library of Congress, with documentation completed in 2013.
turn.5: What did his papers consist of?
turn.6: It contains correspondence with an extraordinary range of writers and intellectuals.
turn.7: Did he have any other correspondence?
turn.8: Marshall A. Best started as apprentice to Huebsch at B.W. Huebsch in 1923, right after graduating from Harvard University, continued with Huebsch at Viking Press in 1925, became one of Viking's chief editors and eventually chairman of its executive committee.
turn.9: Did he work with anyone else?
turn.10: Best worked with numerous American authors, including: Erskine Caldwell (a client of Maxim Lieber), Sheldon Cheney, Malcolm Cowley, Howard Mumford Jones, Rex Stout, Theodore Morrison, Dorothy Parker, Alexander Woollcott, Wallace Stegner, Lionel Trilling.
turn.11: What other authors did he work with?
turn.12: He also worked with many British authors, including: Graham Greene, Rebecca West, Sylvia Townsend Warner, Rumer Godden, and Iris Murdoch.
